page.title: 11The School.Kingsbury.
page.content: Our primary school is 107 years old.It is made of hamstone and has 3 classrooms,one of which is used for an assembly hall and dinner room.In 1985/ 6 the house,which is attached to one end of the school,is to be used to make a classroom so that one of the present classrooms can be used as a hall.73 children attend now(1985).They come from an area which includes the villages of Kingsbury,Stembridge and East and West Lambrook.50 come by car, 19 cycle and 4 walk.20 children have school dinners,which come in sealed containers from Stoke-sub-Hamdon.The others bring sandwiches.The school has a playground,a field and an open air swimming pool.To the west of the school field is a field used for grazing and silage,to the north is an orchard.This week(July 1985)we planted 10 oak trees at the edge of the field.
